meanings.definition: Speak badly of or tell lies about (someone) so as to damage their reputation.
meanings.sent1: Some people traduce others out of jealousy.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to traduce someone behind their back.
meanings.sent3: The gossip tried to traduce her neighbor's character.
meanings.sent4: Her false accusations traduce his good name.
meanings.sent5: The rumors aimed to traduce her integrity.

meanings.definition: To expose to shame or blame by means of falsehood and misrepresentation.
meanings.sent1: He attempted to traduce his rival in order to win the competition.
meanings.sent2: The tabloid magazine often traduces celebrities for profit.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his hat would traduce him if it could talk.
meanings.sent4: The misleading advertisement tried to traduce the competitor's product.
meanings.sent5: The political smear campaign aimed to traduce his opponent's character.
